Q1: What is the name of the count who inherited the countship of Soissons in 1302?
A1: John V.

Q2: Who was John V's father?
A2: John IV, Count of Soissons.

Q3: What is known about John V's brief rule of the county?
A3: Nothing is known.

Q4: Did John V marry and have any heirs?
A4: No.

Q5: Who became Count of Soissons after John V's death?
A5: His brother Hugh.

Q6: What is the name of the book written by C. Dormay that provides information about the history of Soissons and its rulers?
A6: "Histoire de la ville de Soissons et de ses rois, ducs, comtes et gouverneurs".

Q7: When was this book published?
A7: 1664.

Q8: Is the book available on Google Books?
A8: Yes.

Q9: Can you summarize the main information provided in the passage about John V?
A9: John V was the Count of Soissons who inherited the countship from his father in 1302, but nothing is known about his brief rule and he died without any heirs.

Q10: How many brothers did John V have?
A10: One brother, Hugh.

Q1: Who was William Busac?
A1: William Busac was the son of William I, Count of Eu, and his wife Lesceline, and was Count of Eu and Count of Soissons, de jure uxoris.

Q2: What was the nickname given to William by a medieval chronicler?
A2: The nickname given to William by a medieval chronicler was "Busac".

Q3: Who did William appeal to for marriage?
A3: William appealed to King Henry I of France for marriage with Adelaide, the heiress of the county of Soissons.

Q4: How many children did William and his wife Adelaide have?
A4: William and Adelaide had four children: Renaud II, Count of Soissons (died 1099), John I, Count of Soissons (died after 1115), Manasses of Soissons, Bishop of Cambrai and Bishop of Soissons (died 1 Mar 1108), and Lithuise de Blois, married to Milo I of Montlhéry.

Q5: Who became Count of Soissons after William's death?
A5: After William's death, his son Renaud became Count of Soissons.

Q6: What was the name of William's brother who succeeded him as Count of Soissons?
A6: William's brother John I succeeded him as Count of Soissons.

Q7: Who was Adelaide, the heiress of the county of Soissons?
A7: Adelaide was the daughter of Renaud I, Count of Soissons and Grand Master of the Hotel de France, and was the heiress of the county of Soissons.

Q8: What was the name of William's wife?
A8: William's wife was Lesceline.

Q9: How many children did William and his wife Adelaide have?
A9: William and Adelaide had four children.

Q10: When did William die?
A10: William died in 1076.

Q1: Who was Jeanne de Bar's father?
A1: Jeanne de Bar's father was Robert of Bar, Count of Marle and Soissons, Sire d'Oisy.

Q2: What was the name of Jeanne de Bar's stepfather?
A2: Jeanne de Bar's stepfather was John II of Luxembourg, Count of Ligny and de Guise.

Q3: Who was Jeanne de Bar's husband?
A3: Jeanne de Bar married Louis of Luxembourg, Count of Saint-Pol, Brienne, de Ligny, and Conversano, Constable of France.

Q4: How many children did Jeanne de Bar have with her husband?
A4: Jeanne de Bar had seven children with her husband Louis of Luxembourg.

Q5: What was the name of the eldest son of Jeanne de Bar and her husband?
A5: The eldest son of Jeanne de Bar and her husband was John of Luxembourg, Count of Marle and Soissons, Governor of Burgundy.
